column4: Also understand Gnome is the default gui, been using kde mostly, hows the gnome aspect? alot different?
cool, one last question though, hows the package selections? I like graphics and web work
there's something like 17,000 packages in Ubuntu's repos, you'll probably be able to find what you need :)

not many;  you might want to still run the 32bit version of Ubuntu on it, there are some issues w/ the full 64bit version (no Flash, for example. The problems are mostly with the non-Free stuff, though)
ext3 is the Ubuntu installer's default, anyway
very. Just right-click on the ISO & select Burn To Disc, assuming you're in Ubuntu.
